case_vignette: A mother brings her 3-year-old son to the doctor because she is worried that he might be harming himself by constantly banging his head on the wall. He has been exhibiting this behavior for a few months. She is also worried because he has started to speak less than he used to and does not respond when his name is called. He seems aloof during playtime with other children and seems to have lost interest in most of his toys.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I keep hitting my head on the wall, I'm not talking as much, and I don't really answer when you call my name.
How old are you?
I'm 3 years old.
Are you a boy or a girl?
I'm a boy.
Have you reached developmental milestones at the expected times, like walking and talking?
Yes, but I'm talking less now than I used to.
Have you experienced any seizures or loss of consciousness?
No, I haven't had any seizures or lost consciousness.
Has your family noticed any changes in your social interactions or interests?
Yes, I seem aloof when playing with other kids and have lost interest in most of my toys.
Does your family have a history of developmental disorders, such as autism or ADHD?
The vignette doesn't give me any information about my family's medical history, so I don't know.
Have you recently had any illnesses, injuries, or changes in your routine or environment?
The vignette doesn't mention any recent illnesses, injuries, or changes in my routine or environment.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD)
